Maybe, but it seems like with JUnit's Description technique, for all tests
=
to be 'rooted', they must be described before the test is initiated. Hence
=
the number of tests that will be executed must also be known. Right now,
Re=
quests and Descriptions are immutable, if they either became modifiable or
=
a subclass that was marked as 'incomplete' existed, then that would be
grea=
t.

Phill

On 6/18/09, C=C3=A9dric Beust =E2=99=94 <cbeust@...> wrot=
e:
>
>
>
> On Thu, Jun 18, 2009 at 3:53 PM, P Baker <me@...<me%40=
retrodict.com>>
> wrote:
>
> > I think rearranging some of the logic would =
work. The use case is
> > this: @Parameters connects to a database to popul=
ate an array of
> > parameters, however, the database connection is instant=
iated in a
> > @BeforeClass method. This is my definition of 'lazy loading'=
, the
> > parameters are not known at compile time, but only at run time.
>=
 >
> FYI, TestNG implements that by allowing a data provider to return an
>=
 Iterator instead of an array, which allows you to defer the creation of th=
e
> parameters until just before the test method is invoked.
>
> Maybe the =
same idea can be implemented in JUnit.
>
> --
> ***C=C3=A9dric
